item.title: Hacking: Profibus/Profinet
item.description: One of the challenges of pentesting in the OT/ICS environment is given by the protocols used which can also be very different from those of IT. ICS installations use a wide variety of protocols that they often share have little in common with standard Ethernet and TCP/IP. This difference has been the strong point of OT installations for years, protecting them through the mechanism of “security by obscurity”. Now that these protocols are becoming more known and understood, security concerns in these facilities have been heightened.
